Comment.val:
This program is the starting and central point of all eDev to Excel interactive sessions. It can be called directly from anywhere you wish in an application.
Parameters: Step(pi): To optionally specify a starting Wizard point. Last Main Program Variable(pi): To optionally specify the last Main Program variable.
Basically it does: - Run Through a wizard sequence to set up and maintain the interface as required. - Verify that thing a re complete and valid. - Perform the data view export. - Present the end result to the user.
/*To optionally specify a starting Wizard point.*/
/*To optionally specify the last Main Program variable.*/

Text.val: The following variable must ALWAYS be first. This will be our point of reference
for most of our ranges in the sub programs.
The step parameter is used to tells this program where the user is going
Here are the various steps possible:
Blank: direct export
<F>inish (at any one screen, we can click finish to export)
<E>xit when we are done with the Wizard or even the straight export
This parameter can optionally refer to the last variable in the Main Program
Locate on on row 2048 to see if feeding Array driver is required
*** ERRORS ****
The errors will be sorted by screens.
Arranged by type of errors. 4 virtuals exists in this task. If an error is added, simply
do the error verification and if an error occurs, new variable should be true... then insert in any of the
4 variables (Need To Go To ...) as an <OR> condition
Errors that should not even make a screen pop up
Errors that should make wizard stop at wizard step 1: Configuration
Errors that should make wizard stop at wizard step 2: Scope
Errors that should make wizard stop at wizard step 3: Details
Errors that should make wizard stop at wizard step 4: Path
Virtuals to simplify coding: to tell us if we need to go to a certain screen
Populate driver since this is the main engine that will make this utility run
Verify all the errors and update any options/error flag that we need in this task
If task ID is missing, we can't identify task so we stop
While user doesn't want to exit
Configuration Step
See Arguments in Call Cnd=No below
Scope Step
See Arguments in Call Cnd=No below
Detail Step
See Arguments in Call Cnd=No below
Path Step
See Arguments in Call Cnd=No below
Export Step (either called directly or from a Finish button)
Exit out of loop once this is done unless going back to Path Selection
After coming out of any screen and not exit, re-verify everyting
Reset parameter on the way out

ExpSyntax.val: MlsTrans('No task ID found for the current program')&'!'

Text.val: Variable name as entered in the code
Variable named as wanted by the user to export
Init the following virtual with a valid File path to produce a detailed trace for
any failing export resulting from the DataViewTo() functions in this text file
For example: eDevToExcel.log
Since the variables in arguments of dataview function are concatenations, we need to accumulate them
Generation 2 because:
Program ran by user -----> DATA VIEW TO ----> Current Task (export)
Change border if the field is not blank (blank means default). Change to value of the field
Goto Path selection wizard
The varindex does not accept the full name variable. We have to strip it down and take away the [TABLE]. part
of [TABLE].[FIELDNAME]
If a name to export is blank, use by default the field name and see comment above.

ExpSyntax.val: MlsTrans('Details were saved in Log file')&':'&{2,26}

Text.val: See if there is a non-deleted variable
Only count as deleted if there is anything in the detail to begin with
Now find out if there is a variable tagged
**** ERRORS ****
Errors that completely stop process
Errors to make Configuration Screen appear
Errors to make Scope Screen appear
If all variables are deleted, delete records themselves
Errors to make Detail Screen appear
Errors to make Export Screen appear
Summary virtuals
Configuration screen only if error needs to go to scope but
that's not where user is going
